009
010package imagingbook.lib.color;
011
012import java.awt.Color;
013
014import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
015
016/*
017 * This is only a utility class to hold static methods used by CIELAB and CIELUV color spaces.
018 * Should be modified to implement a a subclass of ColorSpace!
019 * TODO: duplicate in pub/color/image?? Add add JavaDoc!
020 */
021
022public abstract class sRgbUtil {
023        
024        // double versions of Gamma correction
025        
026    public static double gammaFwd(double lc) {  // input: linear component value
027                return (lc > 0.0031308) ?
028                        (1.055 * Math.pow(lc, 1/2.4) - 0.055) :
029                        (lc * 12.92);
030    }
031    
032    public static double gammaInv(double nc) {  // input: nonlinear component value
033        return (nc > 0.03928) ?
034                        Math.pow((nc + 0.055)/1.055, 2.4) :
035                        (nc / 12.92);
036    }
037    
038    public static float[] sRgbToRgb(float[] srgb) {     // all components in [0,1]
039                float R = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[0]);
040                float G = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[1]);
041                float B = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[2]);
042        return new float[] {R,G,B};
043    }
044
045    public static float[] rgbToSrgb(float[] rgb) {      // all components in [0,1]
046                float sR = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(rgb[0]);
047                float sG = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(rgb[1]);
048                float sB = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(rgb[2]);
049                return new float[] {sR,sG,sB};
050    }
051    
052    // --------------------------------------------------------------
053    
054    /**
055     * Interpolates linearly between two specified colors.
056     * @param ca first color (to be interpolated from)
057     * @param cb second color (to be interpolated to)
058     * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
059     * @return the interpolated color
060     */
061    public static Color interpolate(Color ca, Color cb, double t) {
062        if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
063                throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
064        }
065                float[] a = ca.getRGBColorComponents(null);
066                float[] b = cb.getRGBColorComponents(null);
067                float[] c = Matrix.lerp(a, b, (float) t);
068                return new Color(c[0], c[1], c[2]);
069        }
070    
071    /**
072     * Interpolates linearly between the colors in the specified color palette.
073     * The interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1]. If 0, the first palette color
074     * is returned, if 1 the last color.
075     * @param palette an array of colors (at least 2)
076     * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
077     * @return the interpolated color
078     */
079    public static Color interpolate(Color[] palette, double t) {
080        if (palette.length < 2) {
081                throw new IllegalArgumentException("length of color palette must be at least 2 but is " + palette.length);
082        }
083        if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
084                throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
085        }
086                final int n = palette.length;
087                double x = t * (n - 1);                 // x = 0,...,n-1 (float palette index)
088                int lo = (int) Math.floor(x);   // lower palette color index
089                int hi = (int) Math.ceil(x);    // upper palette color index
090                return interpolate(palette[lo], palette[hi], x - lo);
091        }
092    
093}
